abstract: JPMorgan Chase reported better-than-expected revenue growth, buoyed by improving credit conditions among consumers and continued demand for new loans.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase reported better-than-expected revenue growth, buoyed by improving credit conditions among consumers and continued demand for new loans.

lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase’s Earnings Beat Expectations  |  Kicking off a series of earnings reports from the nation’s biggest banks in the coming days, JPMorgan Chase said Friday that it earned $1.31 a share in the first quarter of 2012, compared with $1.28 a share in the same period a year ago. On a reported basis, revenue rose 6 percent, rising to $26.7 billion, from $25.2 billion.

abstract: Wells Fargo reported earnings of $4.2 billion, or 75 cents a share, as its loan portfolio continued to improve.
snippet: Wells Fargo reported earnings of $4.2 billion, or 75 cents a share, as its loan portfolio continued to improve.
lead_paragraph: Wells Fargo, one of the nation’s largest consumer lenders, posted a 13 percent increase in first-quarter profit on Friday, the latest in a series of upbeat report cards for the bank.

headline.main: Wells Fargo Profit Rises 13%, as Revenue Increases

abstract: JPMorgan Chase and Wells Fargo may have beating analyst estimates. But their earnings results weren’t enough to prevent bank stocks from sagging on Friday.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase and Wells Fargo may have beating analyst estimates. But their earnings results weren’t enough to prevent bank stocks from sagging on Friday.
lead_paragraph: Congratulations to JPMorgan Chase and Wells Fargo for beating estimates. Yet, those earnings reports weren’t enough to prevent a sagging in bank stocks on Friday.

headline.main: Despite Good News, U.S. Bank Stocks Fall

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: In first-quarter earnings reports on Friday, Wells Fargo and JPMorgan Chase said a recent move by bank regulators had led them to increase their totals for at-risk junior-lien mortgages.
snippet: In first-quarter earnings reports on Friday, Wells Fargo and JPMorgan Chase said a recent move by bank regulators had led them to increase their totals for at-risk junior-lien mortgages.
lead_paragraph: A little more light is being shed on a type of loan that has been stinking up bank balance sheets.

headline.main: New Figures Stoke the Home Inequity Debate

abstract: JPMorgan’s long-term debt costs need to be watched closely. In the first quarter, JPMorgan paid a higher interest rate on its third-largest source of funds – $255 billion of long-term debt.
snippet: JPMorgan’s long-term debt costs need to be watched closely. In the first quarter, JPMorgan paid a higher interest rate on its third-largest source of funds – $255 billion of long-term debt.
lead_paragraph: One number in JPMorgan Chase’s first-quarter earnings suggests that not everyone believes in the fortress balance sheet.

headline.main: What JPMorgan’s Bonds Say About the Fortress Balance Sheet
